Header: Minister Arjuna Ranatunga celebrates a birthday
Content: The 52nd birthday of Minister of Ports and Shipping, Arjuna Ranatunga was celebrated today. A religious event was organised at the Minuwangoda Raja Maha Viharaya to mark the birthday of Minister Arjuna Ranatunga on December 1. Thereafter, a special event was also organised to mark this special day. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe presided over the event which also saw the one year anniversary of the December Revolution being marked. The Prime Minister stated: For five years he was with us in the opposition, and he is aware of the issues that we faced and when the country is degenerating, when the economy is collapsing and when the people are finding it difficult to live, we all came together and made Maithripala Sirisena our candidate and elected him as the President and he served in the cabinet since then. Minister of Ports and Shipping,Arjuna Ranatunga meanwhile stated: Tthe objective of parliament and the cabinet is to focus on how the future of this country needs to be and we were able to bring together the leaders of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and the United National Party and build a government. Today, all the groups are working to take this nation forward, but it must be said, there are some groups that are trying to disturb this process. So do not forget that Born on December 1, 1963, Arjuna Ranatunga who brought the glory of the World Cup to Sri Lanka, is a product of Ananda College, Colombo. He retired from cricket in 2001, entered active politics from the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and served as the Deputy Minister of Tourism. He also played an exceptional role in ensuring the victory of Maithripala Sirisena at the presidential election and is the current Minister of Ports and Shipping.
